comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The YALLEROI looks in dreadful condition here, like in this 1913 New Zealand article description - paperspast.natlib.govt.nz/cgi-bin/paperspast?a=d&d=CH...

comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: The Yalleroi survived a little longer, becoming the 'Santa Caterina' in Italian hands from 1906, and was broken up in Genoa in 1923. :- www.bruzelius.info/Nautica/Ships/Merchant/Sail/Y/Yallaroi(1885).html

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Yes you're both right! And I had seen that NZ article. Loved the 'sailor's lament' part. :)
